main event: A report describing an unidentified flying object that appeared as a disc with a bluish center and red edges, shooting toward Earth at a 45Â° angle on 10 January 1948.
interesting points: The object was reported to have no trails or sound,The observers described it as resembling a shooting star,The speed of the object was noted as very high,The object disappeared behind Mt. Tom near Holyoke, Massachusetts, The sighting involved two USAF captains, Kenneth N. Barton and James F. Zegler.
sighted object: a disc-shaped object with a bluish center and red edges
witness description: Captains Kenneth N. Barton and James F. Zegler, USAF (MC)
